summary: The document outlines the escalation process for unresolved issues within a committee at Deutsche Bank, detailing the roles of the Chairperson, Secretary, and other members in tracking and addressing open issues. It emphasizes the importance of communication and accountability in the decision-making process.
keyFacts: The Chairperson of the Committee is responsible for escalating unresolved issues.
The Secretary tracks open issues and ensures closure.
Members of the Committee must be informed of the status of open issues.
Unit sponsors can vote on Committee decisions and escalate disagreements.
The document is marked confidential and is for internal use only.
